column4: hi all. I had to kill update-manager (Ctl+Alt+Bkspace), Now it's complaining about not getting a lock. can I just delete /var/cache/apt/archives/lock ?
you killed it the wrong way. use killall next time
how do I know what the process name is?
you just says it was update-manager!
the only program I could find with update in it was update-notifier, and I wasn't sure it was the same thing
next time I'll do that :) right now I'm stuck with a lock - can I just delete the lock file?
sudo rm /var/cache/apt/archives/lock and cross your fingers
I was hoping for more confidence in the procedure ;), but thanks for your help. so far nothing broken...
apt-get update and apt-get upgrade worked okay
then you are good to go
quanta if you dont mind kde apps
that is weird, goes against the general naming convention...
i know. the relevant kde app is quanta
